name: transport, freight train, electricity | transport, freight train | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4570/documentation

The dataset represents the entire transport life cycle of an electric freight train in China. The data for the energy use and operation emissions are based on "transport, freight train, electricity" dataset for RER. Electricity use per tkm is from CN 2004 statistics (very low rate compared to European statistics), adjusted by a factor of two assuming that the original data are referring to gross tkm. Diesel use for shunting is directly from RER dataset for lack of information on CN. This dataset should not be used for comparisons of locomotive types nor of transport means across different countries but only when transport is not a major contributor to total environmental burdens of a process or product being analyzed.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

The dataset starts with the production of a locomotive.

The dataset ends with the service of transporting 1 ton over a distance of 1 km by an electric freight train. The dataset includes the production and the maintenance of the locomotive and the goods wagon, the construction of the railway track and the energy use and operation emissions of a freight train using electricity. The data for the energy use and operation emissions are based on "transport, freight train, electricity" dataset for RER but with specific Chinese electricity consumption.
category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/491:Transport via railways/4912:Freight rail transport

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: RER model and operation model with specific CN electricity intensity. The 2004 China official statistics on the number of locomotives in operation in all railway Companies (national and local) give the shares 69.7%, 28.7% and 1.5% for diesel, electricity and steam , respectively. The electric train operation is also based upon the corresponding RER dataset in. However, also in this case the Chinese official statistics give a much lower energy use that the European ones, 3.6 time lower electricity consumption per tkm. Again, the original value has been increased by a factor of 2.67 and the uncertainty factor has been increased compared to the corresponding item in (Spielmann et al. 2004). In this dataset, the diesel consumption for diesel locomotives used in shunting has accordingly been decreased from the European value.;References:;Spielmann M., Kägi T., Stadler P. and Tietje O. (2004) Life cycle inventoriesof transport services. Final report ecoinvent 2000 No. 14. UNS, ETH-Zurich,Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Duebendorf, CH, retrieved from:www.ecoinvent.ch.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset transport of coal by train in China is based on “transport, freight train, electricity (RER)” but instead of “transport, freight train, electricity (RER)” the input is defined to reflect the use of electric locomotives in the coal industry and in China in general. Demand factors of various transport components (as described in the previous sections) required to fulfill the functional unit of one tkm fright transport are presented. In order to account for the fact that the same rail tracks are used for both passenger and goods transportation are applied allocation factors.

flow.name: transport, freight train
flow.category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/491:Transport via railways/4912:Freight rail transport

exchanges.description: Literature value provided by Expert Panel on Heavy Metals and POPs of the UNECE Task Force on Emission Inventories EEA (2000). However, these emission factors have to be considered as preliminary estimates only. More measurements are needed in order to confirm these values. Energy use and operation emissions

Literature value. Due to the fact that on the Swiss rail network only very few diesel locomotives are in operation emissions to air are limited to particulate emissions due to abrasion and emission of sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) occurring during conversion at traction substations. For sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) emitted during conversion at traction substations we assume an emission index of 4.4E-08 kg/kWh Frischknecht (2003) resulting in a specific emission of 3.79E-09 kg/tkm. Energy use and operation emissions
Estimated value. In this dataset, the diesel consumption for diesel locomotives used in shunting has accordingly been decreased from the European value.

exchanges.description: Literature value. Average emission factors for Swiss heavy good vehicles (HGV) for urban traffic conditions in 2000 derived from INFRAS (1999). the presented figures of NMVOC emissions still contain emissions of Benzene, Toulol and Xylol. Energy use and operation emissions

Estimated value. Abrasion (from braking lining, rail and wheel) is predominately composed of iron and mineral components BUWAL (2002). In this study is assumed that all non-airborne emissions are emitted as iron to soil. In consequence, is assumed a yearly load of 191.8 t/a iron emitted to soil. Emission of lubricates due to traction are not accounted for, since measures are in operation to avoid such emissions. Energy use and operation emissions Further references: BUWAL (2002) PM10-Emissionen des Verkehrs. Statusbericht; Teil Schienenverkehr. 144. Bundesamt fuer Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft, Bern

Literature value provided by Expert Panel on Heavy Metals and POPs of the UNECE Task Force on Emission Inventories EEA (2000). However, these emission factors have to be considered as preliminary estimates only. More measurements are needed in order to confirm these values. Energy use and operation emissions

Estimated value. In this project CO2 indice is estimated assuming that all carbon in the fuel is transformed completely into CO2. For CO2 is employed an emission index of 73.5 g/MJ or 3146 g/kg.Energy use and operation emissions

Literature value provided by Expert Panel on Heavy Metals and POPs of the UNECE Task Force on Emission Inventories EEA (2000). However, these emission factors have to be considered as preliminary estimates only. More measurements are needed in order to confirm these values. Energy use and operation emissions

Estimated value.In this project SO2 indice is estimated assuming that all sulphur in the fuel is transformed completely into SO2. In line with assumptions made for road transport is assumed a sulphur content of 300 ppm resulting in a emission index of 0.6 g/kg. Energy use and operation emissions

However, also in this case the Chinese official statistics give a much lower energy use that the European ones, 3.6 time lower electricity consumption per tkm. Again, the original value has been increased by a factor of 2.67 and the uncertainty factor has been increased compared to the corresponding item in (Spielmann et al. 2004).
